title: More vents and concrete and stuff
body:
A pitted, bumpy, sloped floor is not ideal when it comes time to lay vinyl. Hell, it's not even ideal for cassette tapes! *rim shot* Here's how we went about leveling the floor, with some HVAC pictures thrown in for good measure.



The biggest dip was in the concession area... but enough about my dad! Ha ha ha! I kill me. Here's old man Dan "floating" a massive amount of concrete in the Cinebar area. Thanks to his handy work, the only person who will have frequent falls in the Cinebar will be me.



More floating.



Here's a couple examples of my handy work. This was a hole I filled near the lady's restroom.



This was another hole I filled in the doorway of the projection booth. There were many more examples, but I don't want to bore you.



No, that's not an attacking tripod from War of the Worlds - it's a massive heap of HVAC. Somewhere in that tangled mess of duct and insulation... lies a... heart... of... I forgot what I was going to say.



Hey! Check it out! It's the exhaust vent for the projection booth. Could these pictures get any more exciting?!



This is the giant exhaust hole for the giant heat exchanger that sits atop the giant lady's restroom. It's just big enough to hold three adolescent boys and a buffalo nickel. Anybody catch the reference???

That blurry bit in the lower left corner is the arm of the Michelin Man. He happened to be running by just as I snapped this picture.



This is the intake hole. The end.
author: Dan
